item.description:
With the holiday on the 16th, some of us might be up for some games this Sunday evening.

This event will focus on party games.  Party games are usually humorous attempts at testing your knowledge of pop culture or vocabulary, your creativity or artistic skills and your ability to communicate with others.  And some are just competitions of who can be the most foolish. :-) The goal of playing these is to see your friends in a new light and make some new ones. :-)

Some examples of party games are:

  • Morphology
  • Pictionary
  • Linq
  • Cranium
  • Luck of the Draw
  • Quelf
  • 25 Words or Less
  • Psychiatrist

So if you like any of these games or want to learn more about this genre, this event will be for you.  We welcome new players with open arms.

Tonight's featured game will be Quelf.  This is a game where we act a little crazy so it may not be for everyone.  It has been requested but you don't have to play this tonight if you aren't comfortable.

---

Snacks:

I'll have some beverages available. Please feel free to bring snacks.

---

About the location:

We will be playing in the community room of the Essex building.

Please meet at the front door of The Essex condo (11 Church St, Salem - across from what some folks call "the Almy's parking lot" - you'll see the green awning) and then Sandy will take everyone downstairs to the Essex Room. Those who arrive later will need to call Sandy to get in (978-219-9292). Her number/directions will be posted on the front door.

The on-street and metered lot parking (small lots) is free on Sunday. Large parking lot is only free after 8pm. If you park in the garage Sandy can sell you a validation sticker that gives you free parking.

group.name: The Salem Board Games Meetup Group

item.name: Party Game Night in Salem
